column2: 1. Which age group do you fall into?
column3: 2. How long have you lived in this estate?
column4: 3. Which floor range is your unit located on?
column5: 4. On a normal day, how would you rate the noise level from 1 to 10?
column6: 5. What are the main noise sources you notice most often?
column7: 6. Does the noise ever spike during specific hours / events?
column8: 7. How does the noise level affect your ability to concentrate (studying, working)?
column9: What are some existing solutions in your living area to address the noise issue? Are they effective?
column10: What are some solutions you can think of to noise pollution in your specific living area? (We need your point of view ! :)
column11: 8. How do you find the quality of air in your living area?
column12: What are the reasons for your answer to Qn 8?
column13: 9. Convenience: When there are big festivals or religious practices, events etc, how does it affect your routine?
column14: 10. Does living so close to these cultural/religious hubs make you feel more connected to the community?
column15: 11. Overall, would you say living here improves or reduces your Quality of Life?
column16: 12. Which site do you live in?

column6: Road Traffic / MRT, Commercial Events (Busking, Festivals, Crowds), Construction / Renovation
column9: Government regulations concerning noise. Not really except for night times.
column10: Regulate vehicle honking during certain times (early morning and late night) especially during festive/religious days as this area is prone to severe traffic congestion during prayers days (temple nearby).
column12: Too much traffic. Heavy cooking exhaust from hawker centre below the block
column13: Difficult to drive in/out of the block, or even get to the car parks. Very crowded at the market/hawker centre/MRT station
column14: Yes, I feel a strong connection.

column10: Is fine. Meant to be crowded in this area
column13: Just need to compromise. No nearest supermarket
column14: Yes, I feel a strong connection.

column6: Religious Activities (Bells, Chanting, Processions), Commercial Events (Busking, Festivals, Crowds)
column12: Dusty and polluted due to traffic and burning of incense

column7: The bells start very early in the morning and it's quite repetitive. As a resident who has lived here for a decade, I appreciate the culture, but the acoustic environment has definitely degraded as more tourists and larger sound systems are used during the ceremonies. It makes it very hard to have a quiet Sunday morning which is the only time I have to rest from my stressful job
column10: Enforce decibel limits on outdoor speakers used by the temples

column9: I stay out until late to avoid the noise

column7: It is absolutely ridiculous how loud the buskers are at Bugis Street. I have called the NEA multiple times because the bass vibrates my windows. This isn't just 'vibrancy,' it's a nuisance. We are residents, not just a backdrop for tourists. My children cannot study and my elderly mother gets very agitated by the constant thumping music that goes on until 10 PM. The trade-off for living in the city shouldn't mean losing our sanity to noise
